definition: carpenter's plane/to plane (woodwork)/to shave off/to peel (with a potato peeler etc)
to dig/to excavate/(coll.) to exclude/not to count/to deduct/to subtract
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
"knife" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 18)/see also 立刀旁[li4 dao1 pang2]/see also 側刀旁|侧刀旁[ce4 dao1 pang2]
shaved or crushed ice dessert or beverage
to dig up roots and inquire at the base (idiom); to get to the bottom of sth
lit. to dig up the root/to get to the heart of (the matter)
erhua variant of 刨根[pao2 gen1]

sentences.english: Julia said, raking the ground. “Yeh can call me Elina if you’d like.”

sentences.english: Considerably greater downward pressure is required than for planing wood.
sentences.chinese: 这比刨木头需要更大的向下的压力。

sentences.english: The end is cut at an angle and shaved regularly as it wears out.
sentences.chinese: 底端以角度被切断的和刨光，因为它经常磨损。

sentences.english: Their first home is usually a den, which can be a small cave or a hole dug in the ground.
sentences.chinese: 它们的第一个小家是兽穴，即在地上刨出的坑或洞。

sentences.english: Use either a mandoline or a large-size grater to shred. Set aside.
sentences.chinese: 再用蔬果刨或大刨丝器将之刨成幼丝，备用。

sentences.english: She has just chucked her boyfriend.
sentences.chinese: 她刚刚刨掉了她的男朋友。

sentences.english: Then he scraped away the dirt, and exposed a pine shingle.
sentences.chinese: 5接着他刨去泥土，下面露出一块松木瓦块。

sentences.english: "We began crawling carefully around the ice, yelling the boys' names, " she says.
sentences.chinese: 我们开始小心地刨雪，边刨边呼喊着男孩的名字。

他把那块木料刨得挺平的。
